title: Matchsafe, ""Modern Woodmen of America"", patented 1904
provenance: Collection of Carol B. Brener and Stephen W. Brener
creditline: Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener
description: Rectangular, curved top and bottom, featuring raised decoration, inscribed in circular reserve "Modern Woodmen of America", the center of which displays a shield with a crossed malet and hatchet and monogram "MWA", over circular reserve inscribed "Pur Autre Vie", beneath features an assortment of objects including a scale, urn, and medallion inscribed "Brazen Coin", some foliage motifs interspersed throughout; reverse features male with hatchet raised, chopping a tree trunk, background of trees, cabin, and 2 men on wooden river raft. Lid hinged on side. Striker on bottom.

tombstone.epitaph:
Matchsafe, ""Modern Woodmen of America"", patented 1904.
patented 1904. Plated brass. Gift of Stephen W. Brener and Carol B. Brener. 1978-146-1070.
